name: futurologist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone whose job is to attempt to predict future events (= to say what will happen), usually by studying social, technological, economic, and political change in the past and present: Futurologists have predicted a cashless society ever since the invention of "plastic money". Trend-spotters and futurologists have become an important part of the modern business world.
More examplesFewer examples1950s futurologists promised a bright, clean, push-button future powered by atomic energy.Most futurologists of the time predicted that in the 21st century we would all be either wearing space suits or running around in a post-nuclear wasteland.At the turn of the century futurologists rightly predicted that by 2020 most of us would be using web-enabled mobile devices rather than a landline. The new millennium was a boom time for doom merchants, prophets and futurologists of all kinds.
